meanings.definition: To withstand the action or effect of
meanings.sent1: The sturdy tree was resisting the strong winds.
meanings.sent2: She was resisting the urge to eat the delicious cake.
meanings.sent3: The magnet was resisting the pull of the other magnets, trying to stay away.
meanings.sent4: The superhero was like a shield, resisting all attacks from the villain.
meanings.sent5: The dam was resisting the force of the rushing water, holding it back.

meanings.sent1: The athlete was resisting his opponent's attempts to push him down.
meanings.sent2: The team was resisting the pressure and fighting hard to win the game.
meanings.sent3: The little turtle was resisting the temptation to take a nap and kept moving forward.
meanings.sent4: The flower was resisting the wind, standing tall and proud in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The soldier was resisting the enemy's advance, defending his position bravely.

meanings.definition: To refuse to accept or comply with
meanings.sent1: The child was resisting his bedtime, not wanting to go to sleep.
meanings.sent2: She was resisting the new rules imposed by the company.
meanings.sent3: The cat was resisting the idea of taking a bath, hiding under the bed.
meanings.sent4: The student was resisting the teacher's instructions, insisting on doing it his way.
meanings.sent5: The worker was resisting the pay cut, demanding fair treatment.
